verses.kjv: And if a soul sin, and hear the voice of swearing, and is a witness, whether he hath seen or known of it; if he do not utter it, then he shall bear his iniquity.
verses.ct: If someone sins by refusing to speak up after hearing a public call for witnesses — even though they saw or learned about the matter — they will be held responsible for their guilt.

verses.kjv: Or if a soul touch any unclean thing, whether it be a carcase of an unclean beast, or a carcase of unclean cattle, or the carcase of unclean creeping things, and if it be hidden from him; he also shall be unclean, and guilty.
verses.ct: Or if someone touches anything ritually unclean — whether the dead body of an unclean wild animal, an unclean domestic animal, or an unclean creature that crawls on the ground — even without realizing it, that person becomes unclean and guilty.

verses.kjv: Or if he touch the uncleanness of man, whatsoever uncleanness it be that a man shall be defiled withal, and it be hid from him; when he knoweth of it, then he shall be guilty.
verses.ct: Or if someone comes into contact with human uncleanness of any kind that would make a person impure, and they don't realize it at first, once they become aware of it, they are guilty.

verses.kjv: Or if a soul swear, pronouncing with his lips to do evil, or to do good, whatsoever it be that a man shall pronounce with an oath, and it be hid from him; when he knoweth of it, then he shall be guilty in one of these.
verses.ct: Or if someone makes a careless oath — swearing rashly to do something harmful or something good, whatever kind of oath a person might blurt out — and doesn't realize it at the time, once they become aware of it, they are guilty of one of these offenses.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, when he shall be guilty in one of these things, that he shall confess that he hath sinned in that thing:
verses.ct: When someone becomes guilty of any of these things, they must confess the specific sin they committed.

verses.kjv: And he shall bring his trespass offering unto the LORD for his sin which he hath sinned, a female from the flock, a lamb or a kid of the goats, for a sin offering; and the priest shall make an atonement for him concerning his sin.
verses.ct: Then they must bring their guilt offering to the LORD for the sin they committed: a female animal from the flock, either a lamb or a young goat, as a sin offering. The priest will then perform the atonement for their sin.

verses.kjv: And if he be not able to bring a lamb, then he shall bring for his trespass, which he hath committed, two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, unto the LORD; one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering.
verses.ct: If the person cannot afford a lamb, they must bring 2 turtledoves or 2 young pigeons to the LORD as their penalty for the wrong they committed — one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering.

verses.kjv: And he shall bring them unto the priest, who shall offer that which is for the sin offering first, and wring off his head from his neck, but shall not divide it asunder:
verses.ct: They must bring them to the priest, who will present the one for the sin offering first. He will twist its head at the neck but not completely separate it from the body.

verses.kjv: And he shall sprinkle of the blood of the sin offering upon the side of the altar; and the rest of the blood shall be wrung out at the bottom of the altar: it is a sin offering.
verses.ct: Then he will sprinkle some of the blood from the sin offering against the side of the altar, and the remaining blood will be drained out at the base of the altar. This is a sin offering.

verses.kjv: And he shall offer the second for a burnt offering, according to the manner: and the priest shall make an atonement for him for his sin which he hath sinned, and it shall be forgiven him.
verses.ct: He will then prepare the second bird as a burnt offering following the standard procedure. In this way, the priest will perform the atonement for the person's sin, and they will be forgiven.

verses.kjv: But if he be not able to bring two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, then he that sinned shall bring for his offering the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a sin offering; he shall put no oil upon it, neither shall he put any frankincense thereon: for it is a sin offering.
verses.ct: However, if the person cannot afford even 2 turtledoves or 2 young pigeons, they must bring about 2 quarts of fine flour as their sin offering. They must not add oil to it or put frankincense on it, because it is a sin offering.

verses.kjv: Then shall he bring it to the priest, and the priest shall take his handful of it, even a memorial thereof, and burn it on the altar, according to the offerings made by fire unto the LORD: it is a sin offering.
verses.ct: They must bring it to the priest, and the priest will scoop up a handful of it as the representative portion and burn it on the altar along with the other fire offerings to the LORD. This is a sin offering.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall make an atonement for him as touching his sin that he hath sinned in one of these, and it shall be forgiven him: and the remnant shall be the priest’s, as a meat offering.
verses.ct: The priest will perform the atonement for the person regarding whichever of these sins they committed, and they will be forgiven. Whatever flour remains will belong to the priest, just like with a grain offering.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: If a soul commit a trespass, and sin through ignorance, in the holy things of the LORD; then he shall bring for his trespass unto the LORD a ram without blemish out of the flocks, with thy estimation by shekels of silver, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for a trespass offering:
verses.ct: "If someone commits a violation by unintentionally misusing any of the LORD's sacred things, they must bring their guilt offering to the LORD: a ram without any defect from the flock, valued in silver shekels according to the sanctuary standard, as a guilt offering.

verses.kjv: And he shall make amends for the harm that he hath done in the holy thing, and shall add the fifth part thereto, and give it unto the priest: and the priest shall make an atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering, and it shall be forgiven him.
verses.ct: They must also make full restitution for what they failed to contribute regarding the sacred things, adding an extra 20 percent to it, and give it to the priest. The priest will then perform the atonement for them using the ram of the guilt offering, and they will be forgiven.

verses.kjv: And if a soul sin, and commit any of these things which are forbidden to be done by the commandments of the LORD; though he wist it not, yet is he guilty, and shall bear his iniquity.
verses.ct: If someone sins by violating any of the LORD's commands — even without knowing it — they are still guilty and must bear the consequences of their wrongdoing.

verses.kjv: And he shall bring a ram without blemish out of the flock, with thy estimation, for a trespass offering, unto the priest: and the priest shall make an atonement for him concerning his ignorance wherein he erred and wist it not, and it shall be forgiven him.
verses.ct: They must bring a ram without any defect from the flock, properly valued, as a guilt offering to the priest. The priest will perform the atonement for the unintentional mistake they committed without realizing it, and they will be forgiven.

verses.kjv: It is a trespass offering: he hath certainly trespassed against the LORD.
verses.ct: This is a guilt offering, because the person has certainly committed an offense against the LORD."
